sub_title: Senior Team Leader | Data Science Dept | R&I Clinical Research & Health Data
summary:
I am dedicated to developing new insights in the field of data and life sciences. With over 20 years of experience I have a broad background in working on demanding projects and training employees, where I always see a way to achieve goals. I lead a team of 5 people to develop cloud-based data science tools for non-clinical, pre-clinical, and clinical datasets. My expertise lies at the intersection of medical biology and data science. 

I am a lifelong learner and eager to explore new opportunities to further develop and make use of my competencies in an R&D environment. I am not only passionate about applying science, but also about communicating science. I have presented to high-school students during the yearly Brain Awareness Week, and spoke about my work at BNR Nieuwsradio (650.000 listeners) and Het Klokhuis (400.000 viewers). My work was featured in BBC Horizon, featuring Rory Bremner (2.5 to 3 million viewers).

Let’s connect!

profile_positions.description: With a cross-functional team, we support advances in health food technology by generating data insights for the life science and clinical research community. Bringing health through food to as many people as possible.
profile_positions.title: Senior Team Leader, Data Science Department

profile_positions.description:
▶︎ SN R&I team initiatives award 2022
▶︎ Peer expert to perform Initial Accreditation of Master Data Science for Food and Health, Wageningen University https://www.nvao.net/en/decisions/wageningen-university/m-data-science-for-food-and-health.

With a cross-functional team of data managers, statisticians, and statistical programmers we support advances in health food technology by generating non-clinical, pre-clinical, and clinical data insights. Member of the Clinical Research Community Leadership team.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Life Science Data

profile_positions.description:
▶︎ Combining life science and data science expertise, translating products to market
▶︎ Providing technical and strategic leadership

Development of an in silico platform to assess developmental and reproductive toxicity (DART)

✓ 2021 EUROTOX
▶︎ Published in scientific peer-reviewed journals:
✓ Bioinformatics
✓ Toxicological Research
✓ Frontiers in Pharmacology

Vivaltes offers an assessment of human health effects for compounds/substances used in the chemical, food and pharmaceutical industry. This is done through a combinatorial strategy using lab testing and data science.
profile_positions.title: Lead Bioinformatician and Scientific Project Leader at Vivaltes

profile_positions.description:
▶︎ I supplied services as an independent contractor, applying data science to the life sciences industries. Experienced with e.g. Azure Databricks, Snowflake, RStudio Workbench, RStudio Connect, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, R, Python, Google Cloud Platform, Agile Project Management / Scrum. Certified in Good Clinical Practice (GLP). Specialized in semantic-based integrative data analytics.

Applying my project management skills, communication skills and extensive knowledge on cell biology, genetics, neurobiology, and computer science to data projects at academic hospitals, research institutes, biotech companies, and pharma.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Consultant for Biotech, Pharma, and Biomedical Sciences

profile_positions.description:
▶︎ This project was a collaboration to set up new infrastructure.
▶︎ Using my knowledge of biology, databases, and analytics I process and unlock insights from datasets.
▶︎ The relation is continued from 2018 as a consultant.

ProQR is a clinical stage biotech company in Leiden that discovers and develops unique RNA-based therapies for severe genetic disorders.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist interim @ ProQR Therapeutics NV

company.name: Dept of Human Genetics, Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour, Radboudumc

profile_positions.company: Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition, and Behaviour
profile_positions.description:
▶︎ Provided leadership to a technician, three Ph.D. students and four M.Sc students. 
📣 SUPERVISOR RECOMMENDATION: “Monique is an exceptionally talented postdoc. She is highly motivated, learns new techniques and procedures in no time, and is a sharp and critical thinker. Apart from her scientific qualifications, Monique is a very pleasant person to work and discuss with. She is attentive, professional, a team player and eager to share acquired knowledge.”

▶︎ Research coordinator of NWO Veni and Devon Foundation funded research projects, providing leadership to a technician, three Ph.D. students and four M.Sc students.
▶︎ Obtained €250,000 personal funding from NWO (Veni) and €130,000 from the Devon Foundation.
▶︎ Featured on the television shows "Het Klokhuis", and BBC "Horizon"; and the radio show "BNR news radio".
▶︎ Conducted research activities at Western University, London, Ontario, Canada (2016).
▶︎ Latest submitted study: information was mined from 11 publications, including 14,969 cases and 173,194 controls. Coordinates of 1,532 CNVs were mapped to 2,241 mRNA-coding candidate genes. I combined public databases into my own SQL database to retrieve information on the function of the genes across 58 species.
▶︎ Published in scientific peer-reviewed journals:
✓ Translational Psychiatry
✓ American Journal of Psychiatry
✓ Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry
✓ Disease Models & Mechanisms
✓ American Journal of Medical Genetics
✓ Molecular Psychiatry
✓ Frontiers in Neuroscience
✓ Human Mutation
✓ Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews
✓ Human Molecular Genetics

»FTEs were reduced when overlapping with consulting work (see ProQR and Morphogenics)«

The genetics department has a diagnostic and research division. I collaborated with the Genetics of Brain Function and Drosophila Models of Brain Disorders teams. We use animal models to investigate pathways underlying disease candidate genes for intellectual disability, ADHD, and Alzheimer’s disease.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist / Scientific project leader (e.g. NWO Veni)

▶︎ I studied Golgi cell biology and the assembly of RNA stress granules and uncovered my gene-of-interest had a specific phenotype in heat-induced stress that was not visible in oxidative or starvation stress.

profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
📣 PF member: "I wanted to let you know that you, in some way, inspired me to go onto biology while in University. I was majoring in Chemistry but I had too many questions that related to life and biology that I couldn't look away. So I switched programs. [..] I work with ES and iPS cells now and this is my life for the moment. [..] You helped direct me towards real science. So thank you!"​

▶︎ PF mission: "Our goal is to provide a community for people (whether students, professional scientists, or hobbyists) to learn and discuss science as it is currently generally understood and practiced by the professional scientific community. As our name suggests, our main focus is on physics, but we also have forums for most other academic areas including engineering, chemistry, biology, social sciences, etc. Physics help along with math help and other sciences is available for students."​ physicsforums.com

▶︎ We organized networking events twice each month with the goal to promote local collaboration and career development, helping develop career policy within the Radboud university medical center. The events organized were:
✓ Monthly lunch-time presentation & discussion in the Anatomical Museum (1 hour event)
✓ Monthly after-5 presentation & discussion with Pizza & Beer in the Restaurant (1–2 hour event)

▶︎ We organized the Radboud Science Days 2015, a two-day hospital-wide event with the topic Neuroscience. A variety of hospital themes participated, with the goal to strengthen ties and foster new collaborations between: Disorders of Movement, Neurodevelopmental Disorders, Stress-related Disorders, Alzheimers Disease, and Sensory Disorders.

volunteer_experiences.role: Lecturer for High School students (Brain Awareness Week)
volunteer_experiences.description: ▶︎ Every year the Hersenstichting organizes the Brain Awareness week. I gave two masterclasses about the brain and scientific research to students from the classes HAVO (1x), VWO5 (1x), and VWO6 (2x) at the Leidsche Rijn College, School for Talent Development in Utrecht.

▶︎ Together with several other postdocs I founded the PostdocNL platform, with the goal of uniting and representing postdocs from all backgrounds and knowledge institutions in The Netherlands.
▶︎ I created the visual identity of PostdocNL, I also designed, created, and administer the website http://www.postdocnl.com. As an executive board member I keep oversight of the activities in the general board and am actively involved in project, interacting with stakeholders such as VAWO, PCDI, EP Nuffic, BCF career event, Plan Open Science, Euraxess, minOWC.
▶︎ We lobby with stakeholders who have impact on postdoc policy in the fields of:
✓ Hiring: HR directors UMCs, Universities, KNAW, NFU, VSNU, VNO-NCW
✓ Funding: NWO, ZonMw
✓ Representing: Local postdoc networks, FNV, VAWO
✓ Supporting: PCDI, Federa, Sofokles, EP Nuffic, BCF career event, Plan Open Science, Euraxess
✓ Researching: CWTS, VU/FSW, Rathenau
✓ Governing: minEZ, minOCW
